title.narrative: OUTP 2.1: COMPREHENSIVE Prevention of Mother to Child Transmission of HIV (PMTCT) SERVICES

description.narrative: Output 2.1: All health facilities are fully functional to provide comprehensive Prevention of Mother to Child Transmission of HIV (PMTCT) services., which contributes to Hiv Prevention, Pmtct And Infant Male Circumcision. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 02: Improved and equitable use of proven HIV prevention and treatment interventions by children, pregnant women and adolescents (boys & girls), by 2015.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 2.1: All health facilities are fully functional to provide comprehensive PMTCT services.

Proportion of health facilities with functional MNCH services that have at least one health professional with PMTCT/IYCF/EID skills, & are fully equipped and supplied& regularly monitored to provide these services by 2015.
Proportion of health facilities maintaining at least 80% availability of essential PMTCT drugs
Proportion of health facilities that are providing comprehensive PMTCT services.
